response_parsed.title: sndhdr in Python 3.12+: Common Mistakes, Gotchas, and Best Practices
response_parsed.summary: This guide offers insights into the common pitfalls, best practices, and lesser-known features of using sndhdr in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understand the basic functionality and structure of sndhdr library.
Avoid hardcoding file paths and use os module for better portability.
Use try-except blocks to handle potential errors during reading and writing files.
Utilize type hints for improved code readability and static analysis tools compatibility.
Understand the importance of handling endianness when working with binary data.

code_examples.code:
from sndhdr import Information
info = Information('filename.wav')
print(info)

import os
file_path = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), 'filename.wav')
sndinfo = Information(file_path)

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required to use the latest features and improvements in the sndhdr library.
Ensure you have installed the sndfile Python package using pip install sndfile.
caveats: sndhdr can only handle .wav files at this time, so other audio formats may not be supported.
Be aware that changing certain properties of a .wav file could potentially alter its quality or functionality.
